intro: Jacea hyrcanica, commonly known as the Hyrcanian jacea, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions of Kazakhstan and southern Russia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head, often displaying a yellow or white color. Jacea hyrcanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in its native habitat.
